page.title: 02HATCH BEAUCHAMP BY_PASS
page.content: The by_pass was started on April 16th 1985 and is nearly finished. It will be in use from June 29th onwards. It is three miles long. It is designed to divert most of the heavy traffic on the busy A358, away from Hatch Beauchamp. Many people are pleased about the new road,although it will mean that people in West Hatch, wishing to go to Hatch Beauchamp will have to go down the very narrow Griffin Lane or travel along the by_pass for 4_500 metres. It will also cause some people to go out of business,for example the Scrumpy Shop and a Filling Station have already closed. The by_pass will completely change the character of the village from being noisy to peaceful, we hope! On June 30th there is to be a village party at the playing field, to celebrate the opening of the by_pass.
